intro: Freycinetia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean freycinetia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear both male and female flowers, typical of many monocot species. Its leaves are often used in traditional practices and have a distinct aromatic scent. Freycinetia borneensis is an important component of the tropical rainforest flora in its native habitat.
